When I was 13, my mother started dating a guy who was part of a nasty Australian cult. The Family. My mum knew the guy was a wanker, but by the time she came to her senses they'd had a kid together and... we spent the next three years on the run. The Family chased us all over the country.
(beat) Jesus. That's terrifying.
Why do you think my hair's white?
Julian's straight faced. Is he serious? Before we can haz a guess, an ALARM BLARES. Julian spots TWO GUARDS heading the staircase towards the bridge.
(CONTINUED)
Shit! Abandon ship!
Julian, LAUGHING, GRABS Daniel, pulls him the other way..
A cathedral-like building with a mural: 'HOW LONG IS NOW? Julian and Daniel approach the building.
It's called the Tacheles, it's an artists' squat. They were gonna tear it down in the 90s, but some painters occupied it.
That's cool.
They walk through the gate and we CUT INTO --
A garden of AVANT-GARDE METAL SCULPTURES and IRIDESCENT PAINTINGS. We hear techno music drifting down from above.
FIND a Boccioni style PORTRAIT OF A MAN staring out at us
Pretty great, isn't it?
Julian stands in front of a canvas with Daniel. Daniel no

Now look closer, beyond the image, past the colors... until you've found the element that unlocks the portrait, the single brushstroke that reveals the essence of the painting, of the painter. (then) To me that's what hacking is. Finding that stroke, that code, that tiny point of entry...
Julian looks at Daniel. Looking for his point of entry?
I should get to work.
Abruptly, he heads for the building. Daniel checks the ti
Now?
Julian sprints up the stairs, calling out...
Life on the run, Aussie jet lag, you stop distinguishing between night and day.
Julian brushes past exiting club goers, knocking a GREEN HAIRED TATTOO QUEEN into... Daniel, struggling to keep up
Uh, excuse me.
The woman gives Daniel a LOOK as he slips past her.
More AVANT-GARDE ART and ECCENTRICS moving to MELLOW ELECTRONICA. Daniel finds Julian opening his laptop at on of the TABLES in the corner. Daniel sits and follows suit
So... what are you working on?
Julian lowers his laptop screen, scrutinizing Daniel.
Look, today was fun, but these are sensitive documents, people's lives are at stake.
You can trust me.
Can I?
Julian eyes an ANARCHIST TATTOO, a BLACK CAT on Daniel's arm.
(CONTINUED)
When I was your age I called myself an anarchist too. But do you really want to change the world, Daniel? Or is that just some sticker you wear to look cool.
Daniel's surprised at Julian's SUDDEN CHANGE IN TONE. It' tough, CONFRONTATIONAL, like the tone he took with Otto.
I mean, I've read Orwell, Kropotkin, some Chomsky. 'The burden of proof has to be placed on authority.' You know, all animals are equal.
Julian eyes him, impassive, not responding.
(CONTINUED)
That's Animal Farm? Maybe you've read it.

Daniel gives him a little smile. It's endearing. Julian takes it in... and makes a DECISION. Julian flicks on a CELLULAR MOBILE ROUTER and starts TYPING ON HIS LAPTOP. A CHAT BUBBLE appears on Daniel's laptop.
CLOSE ON CHAT: ircs://chat.wikileaks.org/
Daniel, mystified, glances at Julian then clicks the link A CHAT WINDOW appears on his computer. Julian TYPES. jjj: we talk in here.
Daniel, getting it, leans forward and TYPES. [NOTE: CHAT APPEARS ON OUR SCREEN, LIKE SUBTITLES]. ddd: it's secure? encrypted?
jjj: yes. and quiet.
Daniel SMILES. They start TYPING in QUIET CONVERSATION. jjj: there's a new leak on the submission platform.
ddd: the submission platform?
Daniel looks up at Julian. Julian smiles, mysterious... jjj: In my twenties, I created a tool called Rubberhose...
And suddenly, we SMASH INTO --

A UNIVERSE OF DATA. A DOCUMENT moves at great speed throu an infinite abstraction of facts, figures, information... jjj: It hid sensitive information beneath layers and layers of fake data. Wikileaks is based on the same idea...

...and whenever we move close to the document, it's sudde PROTECTED, wrapped in a multi-layered SMOKESCREEN OF DATA jjj: We constantly upload fake data from fake sources to make it impossible to monitor our real sources...
...the document slides down through WORMHOLES of data... jjj: Their very presence is infinitely deniable.
...FLITTING AWAY from us as we catch up to it... jjj: We keep no records as to when or where you uploaded from, your time zone, your browser...
...the document slips through what feels like the inside the internet, until at last we SMASH TO --
A door opens and a document lands on a FLOOR OF SAND. jjj:   The system makes leaks untraceable.
They simply turn up on the submission platform.
PULL BACK to find THOUSANDS OF DOORS line walls of a spac receding to infinity. WELCOME TO THE SUBMISSION PLATFORM.

A SURREALISTIC VISION, Julian's romantic view of journali ROWS of STEEL DESKS set in sand, a different COMPUTER on each, FLUORESCENTS hanging oddly above. Behind the doors, hear the SOUND OF AN OCEAN. In front, find...
Julian with Daniel, at their Tacheles table. Daniel, taki it all in, spots a few OCCUPIED DESKS. Glowing monitors obscure faces, but we see NAME PLATES. J LIM. T BELLMAN.
A beat, then Julian nudges Daniel. A STACK OF DOCUMENTS s in front of one of the doors. Daniel looks at them, maybe noticing a JULIUS BAER LOGO on the front page. He TYPES. ddd: who's it from?
I have no idea.
Julian smiles at Daniel.
See the beauty of it?
He nods to his laptop, a doc with THE SAME JULIUS BAER LO jjj: ever hear of Julius Baer?
ddd: it's a big Swiss Bank, right?
And now, we SMASH TO --
The grand neoclassical facade of BANK JULIUS BAER. jjj: huge. manages $100 billion for the ultra rich.
We PUSH past the large logo, through a window into --
The rich, traditionally decorated LOBBY of BANK JULIUS BA BANKERS in wealthy suits greet obscenely wealthy CLIENTEL jjj: wealthy assholes in Germany, Switzerland, UK...
A POV SHOT walks us out of the lobby and into...
A HALLWAY OF WOOD CUBICLES, THICK DOORS. The bankers pass us, leading their clients down the hall. ddd: the leak is from someone inside the bank?
jjj: think so, my associate Jay Lim is working the docs.
The POV SHOT FOLLOWS the bankers and their clients into..
A POSH CORNER OFFICE. We see a stack of DOCUMENTS on a TA beside a WHITE BOARD with a SHELL COMPANY DIAGRAM. jjj: we think they show how the bank uses offshore secrecy laws to hide $$ for fat cats.
PAN AROUND THE TABLE TO FIND Daniel and Julian sitting there, looking from the documents to the WHITE BOARD DIAGRAM.
Guten tag.
Julian and Daniel stare at the WHITE BOARD DIAGRAM, now o Julian's laptop. A WAITRESS with a NOSE RING smiles at th
Julian SLAMS SHUT his laptop, paranoid, HOSTILE.
(CONTINUED)
(smile fading, bored) Let me guess. Secret plans for the revolution?
Julian walks out of the cathedral-like building, TAPPING his computer, a MEMORY STICK in the USB slot.
So it's tax evasion.
REVEAL Daniel following behind, carrying all the bags.
On a grand scale. How secure is your computer?
GELI full disk encryption with two factor authentication.
Good. Unlike most reporters, we verify our sources. Jay and our volunteers in Switzerland will analyze the docs, but I need you to confirm they're real.
Julian pulls out the MEMORY STICK, holds it out to Daniel
The meta data should list the authors. Extract it and verify these people work at the bank.
Julian's warm, but Daniel STARES at the memory stick.
What? Did you think we just threw what we got up on the website?
No, but.. you're just giving me the docs?
You said I could trust you.
(mans up, takes the stick) You can.
I know. I'm a good judge of character.
Julian flashes a smile then grabs his things, heads off.
Stay off the internet when working on the docs. And buy yourself a cryptophone.
A familiar hallway. A phone RINGS, breaking the silence.
FIND a FORMIDABLE ASSISTANT in a cubicle outside the posh corner office. She picks up the phone.
Julius Baer, Ralf Zilke's office.
CLOSE ON Daniel, cryptophone to his ear.
I'm sorry, I must have the wrong extension. What division is this?
This is Personal Wealth Management. Who were you looking for?
REVEAL Daniel in small closet filled with cleaning SUPPLI He sits on an overturned MOP BUCKET, a document on his la
Sorry, I was actually looking for...
Daniel eyes TWO LAPTOPS crammed on a shelf. On one, the WHITE BOARD DIAGRAM. On the other, a window of META DATA with A TIME STAMP and a LIST OF AUTHORS, Ralf Zilke and..
...Leisal Grop.
Ms. Grop is down the hall in Client Services. Can I transfer you?
Yes, please. Thank you.
Daniel waits a beat... then HANGS UP THE PHONE. He pulls a pencil, looks down at the document on his lap.
CLOSE ON a marked up LIST OF NAMES. Daniel CHECKS OFF Zil and Grop, begins writing down their divisions when...
The STORE ROOM DOOR OPENS BEHIND HIM.
Daniel? What are you doing in here?
Daniel turns. Anke is in the door. Just then, one of his computers BEEPS. A chat pops up. TBellman: Daniel, I'm Thomas Bellman, WL's Swiss spokesman. Julian said you're working on the bank docs?
Daniel, what's going on?
Daniel looks from the computer to Anke, AWKWARD.
I'm doing some.. sensitive research.
The laptop BEEPS again. Daniel, UNCOMFORTABLE, turns to i TBellman: Daniel? Have you confirmed authorship of the docs?
Anke is CURIOUS. Daniel TYPES, tries to block her view. ddd: The authors are all bank employees... THE DOCS ARE REAL.
As he finishes, a FLURRY OF CHAT pops up on screen -- JayLim: Hey, is Julian plugged in?
jjj: Hoi. Just landed. What's up?
JayLim: Our source agreed to explain the docs, can anyone get to Liege-Guillemins in Belgium by 4pm?
TBellman: Daniel's in Germany, that's not too far.
JayLim: Is he up for it?
jjj: I think so... if he's not too busy sucking off THE CORPORATE
Brightly lit monitors obscure faces but the nameplates ar now familiar. J LIM, T BELLMAN, J ASSANGE...
Julian PEEKS OUT from behind his monitor, smiles at Danie
Is this some kind of geeky, hacker version of Dungeons and Dragons?

head_text.subj: SMASH BACK TO THE EDS STORE ROOM

text: Daniel turns, sees Anke LOOKING OVER HIS SHOULDER. He quickly shuts his laptop. Then, TRYING TO IMPRESS --
We're investigating corruption in a large swiss bank.
Anke BLINKS, intrigued... a political side to Daniel.
Well, in that case, I can cover for you.
Off Daniel, a HINT OF A SMILE --
The Calatrava marvel. It's EERILY EMPTY... as we FIND DAN walking up the platform, texting on his phone.
Daniel Berg: at the train station, where's our guy?
A beat then... Thomas Bellman: Le Chat Noir. Heavyset, brown suit.
Daniel starts walking inside. His phone BUZZES, He checks it. Thomas Bellman: WATCH YOUR BACK.
Daniel pauses, looks over his shoulder. A few travelers, nothing out of the ordinary... until from HIS POV WE SEE HARD LOOKING BALD MAN leaning against a wall, STARING at him.
Is he WATCHING Daniel? Or is it in Daniel's head? Daniel, NERVOUS, pulls up his coat, hurries onward...
CLOSE ON a thick hand, SHAKING, nervously paging through document with more diagrams like the one we saw above.
(in whispers) Our team has been having trouble... the diagrams are a bit impenetrable.
REVEAL HANS, 40s, SWEATING in the rail station cafe. He a Daniel sit at a table. Talking in HUSHED TONES.
They're meant to be. They reveal the bank's most intimate secrets. (passionate, intense)

I worked for these assholes for years before I understood the extent of the deception. It's a massive tax dodge.... last year, those diagrams cheated your country alone out of 30 billion in tax revenues.
And you'll explain them to us?
(nervous) You understand I won't just be exposing the bank. They have hundreds of clients -- wealthy, powerful clients from New York to Moscow who will go to great lengths to hold on to their money.
Just then, Daniel spots a BALD MAN at the bar. Shit, it's the guy from the platform. Daniel TENSES, tries to cover.
We understand the risks.
But Hans follows Daniel's gaze to the bald man... watchin them. Hans looks NERVOUS. Daniel struggles to project cal
We've got incredible infrastructure and hundreds of volunteers, people who've dealt with threats like this. Our process is totally secure -- we don't even know your real name.
You're damn right.
A WOMAN joins the man at the bar.    Hans, anxiety dropping...
I'll explain the documents, but you don't know me, you never met me and when the shit comes down, it's on your house. Are we clear, Mr...
Daniel eyes a SIGN on the wall. A black cat, 'LE CHAT NOI
Schmitt. Daniel Schmitt.
Off Daniel's ADRENALINE RUSH, we hear a SHRILL WHISTLE --
The station's arch glows above Daniel in the dark night. Daniel, WIRED, glances furtively at other travelers.
The bank has a huge network, they've got billions of dollars buried in the Caymans.
A smog filled street. ANCIENT MINIVANS, THRONGS of PEOPLE
Nairobi, Kenya
We PUSH IN on a DILAPIDATED BUILDING and PRELAP --
This is absolutely colossal.
A shabby OFFICE, a few HUMAN RIGHTS POSTERS. Julian helps two Kenyan human rights activists (OULA and KINGARA) hand out PICKET SIGNS to VOLUNTEERS. He talks on a cryptophone
We're gonna nail these bastards.
Daniel warily looks at the passersby. No sign of the bald man from inside, but Daniel's still ON EDGE.
You know, our friend was pretty jittery.
Of course he was.
On Daniel, cold comfort.
Hey, Julian, let's go.
Oula, SCAR on his cheek, beckons to Julian -- they're heading out. Julian looks at his sign: 'ANOTHER WORLD IS
How fast can you get Bellman a summary?
I'll stay up until it's done.
Good. Remember, Daniel, courage is contagious.
Daniel reacts as a train WHISTLES again, the sound fading into a PIERCING TELEPHONE RING --
CLOSE ON a RINGING PHONE. A hand reaches in and we REVEAL the assistant we met earlier, as she picks up.
Julius Baer Bank, Ralf Zilke's office
As she listens, her expression changes and we CUT TO --
A SILVER-HAIRED BANKER (ZILKE) works in a posh corner office, noblesse oblige in a BRIONI SUIT. He reaches for pen when--
Mr. Zilke?
Zilke looks up.
I'm sorry, I just got an odd call from the tech department. They said there's a report on this website... it's posted some of our files. I sent you the link.
Zilke eyes her, then turns to his COMPUTER. He clicks an mail link and up pops THE WIKILEAKS SITE with a DOCUMENT:

head_text.subj: CLOUDS ON THE CAYMAN TAX HEAVEN

text: DOCUMENTS: How the Swiss Bank hides Millions for your favorite fat cats.
Below, a FAMILIAR DIAGRAM. ZILKE SEES IT AND GOES WHITE.
Get me Gregor. And wake up our lawyers in London, in New York, in California...
Daniel back on his mop bucket, staring at two laptops on shelf. On one, a THREATENING E-MAIL from Julius Baer lawyers.
And I thought grinching the printers was impressive.
Daniel turns and finds Anke standing over him with a prin out of the Julius Baer doc. She eyes his computer.
(CONTINUED)
Their lawyers are threatening you?
Julian says you can spend your life in cushy cubicles or you can march. You can brave the truncheons and breathe the tear gas or --
Take a girl to dinner?
An INVITATION. Daniel smiles.
CLOSE on Anke, asleep, NAKED under a cheap coverlet. We h TAPPING on a keyboard. Anke stirs, blinks up at the CHAOS COMPUTER CLUB POSTERS over the bed.
Anke smiles, turns to see... Daniel at a messy desk, tapp on his laptop and pulling on his jeans.
Hey.
Daniel, distracted, TRIPS and FALLS. Anke LAUGHS.
Sorry, I've just never had a guy try to sneak out of his own apartment.
The bank got a judge in California to shut down our primary domain.
He nods to his LAPTOP. A WEB BROWSER points to wikileaks. but the site is down: THE REQUESTED PAGE IS UNAVAILABLE.
A judge in California?
It's where our domain is registered.
Right, but I thought Americans put free speech up there with mom and apple pie.
So did we. Julian wants to meet up right away.
Daniel throws his laptop in his backpack then pauses.
You know this isn't what I imagined for our first... get together.
How often did you imagine it?
Daniel smiles, CAUGHT. He grabs his bag.
You don't have a cryptophone do you?
No, but that may be the best excuse I've ever heard for not calling.
They trade a SMILE and we SMASH TO --

Julian glides down a people mover, TAPPING his phone. As does, e-mail SCROLLS UP THE SCREEN: Friends - Solzhenitsyn says no one can bar the road to truth. Wikileaks.org has been forcibly shut down but you can still learn the truth about Julius Baer on our mirror sites. Send press to http://wikileaks.be, http://88.80.13.160 --
As Julian glides along, typing, we SMASH TO --
Daniel rides the tram talking on his cryptophone.
...blogs, twitter, they're defrauding the world, we can't let them cover it up...
As the tram lurches forward, we see TWITTER FEED start to scroll up the LEFT of the screen... EthanZ Walk the road to truth! http://wikileaks.be Mlsif Break the bank! Send press to 88.80.13.160
The twitter feed CONTINUES TO SCROLL and we SMASH TO --
Julian walks into an all night cafe, hauling his bags.
We never thought we'd need extra servers to fight censorship attacks--
Julian walks into the dingy cafe.
...from the bastion of free speech.
Julian sees TWO OPEN LAPTOPS, a few empty bottles of Club Mate... and DANIEL, on the phone. Daniel doesn't see him.
...I sent links to our mirror sites, if you can post...
Daniel spots Julian, lowers his phone. WARM --
More fun making history than reading about it?
Daniel smiles. A NICE MOMENT... until Daniel's laptop BEE A news alert, WIRED.COM: ACLU, EFF, HEARST FILE BRIEFS IN SUPPORT OF WIKILEAKS CASE. They spring back into action.
...Yeah, and there's a new Wired blog you should post as well...
Julian pulls out his laptop as TWITTER FEED TAKES US TO -
Dawn breaks over Berlin. We hear Julian --
(PRELAP)
Yes, of course, we're pleased the EFF and the ACLU are behind us...
The sun rises over EMPTY BOTTLES, COFFEE CUPS... Daniel a Julian each have two laptops, still going strong. Julian talks on the phone, eats hummus with his finger.
(INTO THE PHONE)
...but the court of public opinion has already ruled in our favor.

Daniel's computer BEEPS again as SITE NOTIFICATIONS start SCROLL UP the RIGHT OF OUR SCREEN, opposite twitter feed. www.largeleaker.de is now pointing to 88.80.13.160 www.screwthebank.com is now pointing to 88.80.13.160
Some french hackers donated domains.
Daniel shows Julian his laptop. Julian lowers his phone, wipes his hummus finger on his pants. Daniel notices.
Send the links to Bellman, he'll blast the list serve.
Daniel reaches forward to type and we SMASH TO --
Half the monitors are lit, DOZENS OF VOLUNTEERS working away.
Daniel opens a CHAT BOX and we RACK FOCUS TO A DESK. We n the nameplate, T BELLMAN.
We CUT BEHIND THE DESK --
Daniel's CHAT pops up on Bellman's MONITOR. As he reaches forward, TWITTER FEED and URLs SCROLL UP our SCREEN. And it's OVERWHELMING, that's what we're going for.
ALAN RUSBRIDGER and IAN KATZ (from the OPEN) review a row one sheets tacked to the wall -- TOMORROW'S PAPER.
Move the US primaries to page three to make room for the Diana inquest.
Yes, Diana still sells papers. 21st century churnalism at its finest.
Rusbridger and Katz turn to find NICK DAVIES (also from t OPEN), all looks and charm in an out of date leather jack
Can't afford reporters? Grab a story off the wire, give it a little scrub and drop it in your paper. (mock smells the print) Just the kind of quality journalism I left Oxford to pursue.
This how you're chatting up the totty in your golden years?
I certainly can't impress them with stories that've been rattling round the mainstream media echo chamber. The women I meet are smart enough to know what they're missing out on.
I assume you're going to tell us what that is?
I'll leave that to Mr. Assange and his merry band of programmers.
He hands them a printout of another tech blog from WIRED. Alan glances at the headline: 'WIKILEAKS VS. GOLIATH.'
As Alan reads, a GOOGLE NEWS SEARCH scrolls over him, UP SCREEN, REPLACING THE TWITTER.
A VIBRANT TURKISH CAFE in an polyglot neighborhood... odd set against a backdrop of blocky West German architecture
Our GOOGLE SEARCH scrolls up the screen and we MATCH CUT
A LAPTOP with the Google News Search. Wikileaks is still live, and kicking THE GUARDIAN - 6 hours ago
Judge Shuts Down Site, Raises Constitutional Issues NEW YORK TIMES - 3 hours ago
Freedom of Speech has a number - 88.80.13.160 CBS NEWS - 30 minutes ago
A mouse CLICKS on the CBS story, which OPENS in a window. next to OPEN STORIES from the Times and the Guardian.
The Guardian, The Times, CBS... are all linking to our mirror sites.
REVEAL Daniel with Julian in a mostly EMPTY cafe, surroun by coffee cups and NEWSPAPERS with JULIUS BAER HEADLINES.
(CONTINUED)
(reading the article) The Bank's injunction has brought an obscure group of dreamers to prominence, paradoxically generating more attention for their apparently uncensorable leaking machine...
Daniel and Julian are HAGGARD, it's plain they haven't sl in days, but they're both FLYING. Daniel scans the paper.
And the bank's clients may now face prosecution in Germany, the US... (thrilled) Jesus, can you believe it? Actual justice for those assholes.
Just then Julian's laptop BEEPS. He reads, STUNNED.
Wow. The judge pulled the injunction. We're back online.
He pulls up wikileaks.org on his laptop. Daniel is FLOORE
Holy shit. We won!
Julian is proud, but Daniel's OVER THE MOON.
We took down a billion dollar bank! This is crazy, we have to celebrate!
...sure, we should order some beers.
I mean with everyone. Bellman and Jay Lim and all the others. This was a team effort, we should get everyone up on Skype or something.
I don't know. It's... late.
I just got an e-mail from Bellman. And Jay was on chat 15 minutes ago.. (then) What? You think Skype isn't secure?
Julian hesitates. Considering SOMETHING. Then --
No... it's probably time for you to meet everyone face to face.
Daniel smiles, pulls up Bellman's account and Jay's. Juli watches, PENSIVE... as Daniel INITIATES the VIDEO CALLS.
We hear the SKYPE RING on Daniel's computer and INTERCUT
ANGLE ten desk rows deep, CAMERA behind a dozen volunteer Daniel and Julian at the cafe table in the distance.
A few monitors LIGHT UP WITH SKYPE CALLS. As volunteers l forward to answer, WE HEAR an ANSWER CHIRP and Daniel's f pops up in a couple of screens.
DANIEL IN THE CAFE, staring at his laptop. CONFUSED.
I don't get it, it says I called...
Daniel looks at Julian, something DAWNING.
A SUBMISSION PLATFORM DESK. Nameplate: T BELLMAN. DOLLY AROUND the monitor on the desk... REVEALING JULIAN.
Nameplate: J LIM. DOLLY AROUND this monitor... Julian aga He looks up, coy.
DANIEL IN THE CAFE. TWO SKYPE BOXES OF JULIAN on his scre
You're Jay and Bellman? (unnerved) How many volunteers do we have?
Hundreds.

head_text.subj: DOLLY AROUND A SERIES OF DESKS/COMPUTERS IN RAPID

text: SUCCESSION. Each time, we find Julian at the computer.
THEN WE PULL BACK TO THE FRONT OF THE ROOM... an infinite number of Julians peek out from the infinite monitors.
We have hundreds of volunteers.
Daniel's pale. He stares at Julian.
What? I have hundreds of e-mail addresses.
That's not the same th--
Julian puts a finger to his lips, WARILY eyes a waiter. H grabs his pack, moves to the back. Daniel follows.
Every startup exaggerates its size. No one's going to leak sensitive material to two freaks with a single server.
We only have one server?
Not as far as the rest of the world is concerned. (then) Castro began a revolution with 82 men. It doesn't matter how small you are if you have faith and a plan of action.
But Daniel is STUNNED...
I told dozens of reporters... our source at Julius Baer...
Necessary fictions. If Julius Baer knew they were up against an army of two...
What, they'd 'rub us out?' They're a bank, not the mob.
Then why have you been using an alias? (pressing) Come on, Daniel. It's just a hack, an inelegant solution.
I have a hundred friends I could call, people who would be happy to help. This is bullshit.
Daniel turns away, pissed. A beat. Then Julian GRABS his backpack and RIPS IT OPEN...
ANGRILY, VIOLENTLY pulling out LAPTOPS, POWERCORDS, CLOTHING; SINGLE SERVINGS of CANNED FRUIT, GLASS JARS of STICKS...
...where is it, where the hell...
Daniel turns, stunned, as Julian pulls out WIRELESS ROUTE SOCKS, SHOES, NOTEBOOKS... until at last he finds...
A SMALL PIECE OF PAPER. Newsprint. Folded and soft with a He THRUSTS it at Daniel. Daniel blinks, confused.
Open it.
Daniel hesitates, then unfolds it.
CLOSE ON an old newspaper article.
May 1995. LEAD 'SUBVERSIVE' TO STAND TRIAL FOR 31 COUNTS HACKING.
Beside the headline, a MUG SHOT of a younger Julian -- a long ponytail and a defiant expression.

There were three of us. Mendax, Trax, Prime Suspect, three boys with cartoon names, off on a series of harmless adventures, 'Subversives' one and all.  But when the Federal Police finally caught up with us, Trax pled guilty and Prime Suspect -- he turned Crown Witness against me.  (beat)  I remember waiting for the verdict in this little room, walking in figure eights like some demented bee, imagining life in a tiny cell. The stress, that was... actually the moment my hair turned.
Daniel takes this in.   A beat, then internal, wounded --
You don't get far in this world by relying on others. People are loyal until it seems opportune not to be.
And now Julian reaches out. Vulnerable.
The tyrants we're up against have money and men and guns and I don't have an army to fight them. All I've got is a website and a couple of fake e-mail addresses and... you.
Off Daniel, YIELDING, we HEAR a recording --
The only way you can control people is to lie to them.
The SUN sets over the GORGEOUS BUILDINGS of OLD ANTWERP.
A HUGE BANNER stretches across the CONVENTION CENTER:

A table COVERED with WIKILEAKS NEWS CLIPS. Some are old ( investigates Julius Baer') but many are new. US MILITARY MANUALS, a PROTEST RIOT IN TIBET... the clips mostly in small, alternative papers. Julian and Daniel have been BU
The only way you can control anybody is to lie to them.
He founded the damn religion. Gobsmacking isn't it?
FIND Julian and Daniel streaming video of Hubbard for a f reporters, their HUMBLE BOOTH dwarfed in a vast room fill with MORE IMPRESSIVE DISPLAYS of old and new media ventur
(off the Hubbard video) This is on your site?
We're streaming it now. See, there are links to all our fresh leaks.
Daniel shows him another laptop. The site is rudimentary, column of analysis and a column of FRESH LEAKS including.
People need to see how they treat their members. The memos on their 'introspection rundowns' -- forced isolation, regulation of meals...
Six Apart would love a piece on this, you have a French spokesman I can follow up with in Paris?
Like watching a young Woodward and Bernstein...
Nick Davies and Ian Katz walk up in GUARDIAN PRESS PASSES
The hallowed Guardian gracing us with their presence?
Julian starts to move towards them but the French reporte pad out, is in his way. Brusquely pushing past --
Would you mind?
The reporter is offended. Daniel, used to this, jumps in.
Our associate Jay Lim is based in Paris. Can I give you his e-mail?
PAN OFF the mollified reporter to Nick shaking Julian's hand.
Hustling for a story, trying to get the world to pay attention, I almost wish I were working for him.
The way they're sacking journalists, you might not have a choice.
Sounds like you want to put us all out of business.
I want you to do your job. If you can't, someone needs to pick up the slack.
Is that what you're doing? Anyone can take a bundle of information, toss it up on a website and call it news. But people buy our papers for something a little more discerning.
They're still buying your papers?
Gentlemen, we're all on the same team. (to Ian) It's the samizdat of our day, Ian, a new nervous system for the planet.
Ian considers the Scientology video... which FREEZES.
